title.narrative: SWE-2010-166 Climate Change, Water & RuralLivelihoods:Assessing Socioeconomic Vulnerability&Potential Adaptive Strategies in Eastern Himalayan Region
SWE-2010-166 Climate Change, Water & RuralLivelihoods:Assessing Socioeconomic Vulnerability&Potential Adaptive Strategies in Eastern Himalayan Region

description.narrative: This study aims to assess the degree of vulnerability of rural communities to climate change in the Eastern Himalayan region of India through a multidisciplinary approach focusing on the links between climate change, water, and livelihoods. The rationale for choosing this region as a study unit is that impact of climate change is greater in this region than other regions of this extensive mountain chain because of its poor socioeconomic development. The methodology will combine an extensive survey involving disciplines of science, sociology, economics and anthropology. It is envisaged that such in-depth analysis of the situation will provide a sound footing to formulate recommendations for adaptive strategies in reducing the vulnerability of the poor, including women in this region, who rely extensively on water resources for their lives and livelihoods.
